skill.name: agent-tools
skill.description: Run 150+ AI apps via inference.sh CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, search, 3D, Twitter automation. Models: FLUX, Veo, Gemini, Grok, Claude, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily, Exa, OpenRouter, and many more. Use when running AI apps, generating images/videos, calling LLMs, web search, or automating Twitter. Triggers: inference.sh, infsh, ai model, run ai, serverless ai, ai api, flux, veo, claude api, image generation, video generation, openrouter, tavily, exa search, twitter api, grok
skill.summary: Run 150+ AI apps via inference.sh CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, search, 3D, Twitter ...
skill.author: inference-sh-0

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation skill for the inference.sh CLI. The static analyzer detected 182 potential issues, but evaluation confirms these are FALSE POSITIVES. The 'external_commands' findings are markdown code blocks showing CLI examples, not actual code execution. 'Network' findings are documentation URLs to inference.sh. 'Env_access' is legitimate - users provide their own API key. The critical heuristic 'Code execution + Network + Credential access' is expected behavior for a cloud AI service tool and poses no security risk.

critical_findings.title: Prompt Injection Check
critical_findings.description: No prompt injection attempts detected in skill files. All content is legitimate documentation for the inference.sh CLI.

medium_findings.title: External Command Documentation
medium_findings.description: Skill contains 132 instances of CLI command examples in markdown code blocks. These are documentation, not actual code execution. FALSE POSITIVE - safe documentation pattern.

medium_findings.title: Network URL References
medium_findings.description: Skill contains 28 hardcoded URLs to inference.sh website. These are legitimate documentation links, not data exfiltration.

low_findings.title: API Key Environment Variable
low_findings.description: Skill instructs users to set INFSH_API_KEY environment variable. This is legitimate - users provide their own credentials to access the service.

content.user_title: Run 150+ Cloud AI Models via inference.sh CLI
content.value_statement: Running AI models locally requires expensive GPU hardware. This skill provides seamless access to 150+ cloud AI models including image generation, video creation, LLMs, and web search through a simple CLI interface.
actual_capabilities: Generate images using FLUX, Gemini, Grok, Seedream models via cloud API
Create videos with Veo 3.1, Seedance, Wan 2.5, OmniHuman
Call LLMs including Claude, Gemini, Kimi, GLM through OpenRouter
Perform web search using Tavily and Exa search engines
Automate Twitter/X posting, DMs, follows, and engagement
Access 3D model generation and media processing utilities
limitations: Requires inference.sh account and API key for service access
Usage costs apply based on cloud API calls (not free)
Requires internet connectivity for all AI model calls
Some advanced features require specific plan tier

use_cases.title: Generate AI Images Without Local GPU
use_cases.description: Create professional images using FLUX, Gemini Pro, or Grok Imagine without owning expensive GPU hardware

use_cases.title: Access Powerful LLMs via CLI
use_cases.description: Call Claude, Gemini, and other LLMs directly from terminal for text generation, analysis, and coding tasks

use_cases.title: Automate Social Media with AI
use_cases.description: Post tweets, send DMs, and manage Twitter/X account programmatically using AI-generated content

prompt_templates.title: List Available AI Models
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all available image generation models using infsh
prompt_templates.scenario: Discover what AI models are available

prompt_templates.title: Generate Image from Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the falai/flux-dev-lora app with prompt 'a futuristic city at sunset'

prompt_templates.title: Call LLM for Text Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use openrouter/claude-sonnet-45 to explain quantum computing in simple terms
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate text using Claude or other LLMs

prompt_templates.title: Search the Web
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for latest AI news using tavily/search-assistant

output_examples.output: Shows a table of featured image generation models including FLUX Pro, Gemini 3 Pro, Grok Imagine with descriptions

output_examples.input: infsh app run falai/flux-dev-lora --input '{"prompt": "a cat astronaut"}'
output_examples.output: Returns task ID and status, then downloads generated image when complete
Returns text response from Claude Sonnet 4.5 explaining the concept

best_practices: Use --no-wait flag for long-running tasks to avoid blocking
Save frequently used input schemas to JSON files for reuse
Check task status with 'infsh task get <id>' for async operations
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts - use environment variables
Avoid running many tasks in parallel without monitoring quotas
Do not skip reading app documentation before running complex apps

faq.question: Do I need to pay to use this skill?
faq.answer: The skill is free to use, but inference.sh API calls have associated costs. Visit inference.sh for pricing details.

faq.question: Which AI models are available?
faq.answer: Over 150 models including FLUX, Veo 3, Claude, Gemini, Grok, Seedance, Tavily, Exa, and many more via OpenRouter.

faq.question: How do I authenticate?
faq.answer: Run 'infsh login' for browser authentication, or set INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for CI/CD usage.

faq.question: Can I use this offline?
faq.answer: No. All AI model calls require internet connectivity as models run on inference.sh cloud servers.

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The allowed tool is Bash(infsh *).

faq.question: How do I monitor usage and costs?
faq.answer: Use 'infsh me' to check your account status and 'infsh task list' to see recent API calls.
